means: 修剪（树木等）( prune的过去式和过去分词 )
精简某事物，除去某事物多余的部分

sentence.Network_en: The company has pruned back its workforce by 20,000 since 1989.
sentence.Network_cn: 公司自1989年以来已裁员两万人。

sentence.Network_en: Next year's budget will have to be drastically pruned.
sentence.Network_cn: 下一年度的预算将大幅度削减.

sentence.Network_en: The roses had been pruned back savagely.
sentence.Network_cn: 玫瑰被狠狠地修剪了一番.

PerfectNetExp.abs: The workers have pruned all the dead branches ., 工人们已经剪去了所有的枯枝.

this wine has been produced from 80-year-old vines at the Chateau . these old vines are dry grown the steep slopes and are hand pruned and harvested .这款葡萄酒所用的葡萄由塔奴丹庄园80年的老藤培育而出，这些老藤生长在陡直的斜坡上，全部用手工剪树枝，采摘葡萄。
To simplify harvesting , the trees are pruned to 8 to 10 feet ., 为了收获简单 , 一般将树剪成 8 到 10 英尺高.

entry.def: A prune is a dried plum.
When you prune a tree or bush, you cut off some of the branches so that it will grow better the next year.

example.ex: You have to prune a bush if you want fruit...
example.tran: 如果想让灌木结果，就必须进行修剪。

example.ex: There is no best way to prune.

entry.def: If you prune something, you cut out all the parts that you do not need.

example.ex: Firms are cutting investment and pruning their product ranges.
example.tran: 公司正在减少投资，缩减产品系列。

means.word_mean: 1. (of plants or trees) shaped by having superfluous branches or shoots trimmed back or cut off;

sentences.sentence: "abundant fruit from properly pruned vines and fruit trees"

auth_sentence.content: He set pack-rat traps and pruned the raspberry patch.
